info.description: The OAuth 2.0 API exposes the resources for third parties to connect to ING APIs using the OAuth 2.0 protocol for authentication and authorization. This API supports the "client credentials", "authorization code" and "refresh token" grant types. Subscription to this API is only required when the Authorization Grant code flow is required for your application. The other supported [OAuth 2.0](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6749) flows can be used without subscription.
info.title: OAuth 2.0 API

post.description: This endpoint enables Third Party Providers (TPPs) onboarding by generating an application identifier (client_id) that will be further used in the authentication flow. The flow will automatically subscribe your application to the allowed ING APIs based on the PSD2 roles in the certificates. This endpoint should only be called once.

post.summary: Retrieve an application or customer access token, or refresh an access token
post.description:
This endpoint allows requesting an access token for one of the flows below:

 ## Client Credentials (Premium APIs usage / registered via ING Developer portal)
For authenticating your application and retrieving an application access token.
Required request parameters:
 - grant_type=client_credentials
 - scope (optional): If not provided, all the subscribed scopes will be returned

 ## Client Credentials (PSD2 usage using eIDAS/OBIE certificates / signed access token)
  For authenticating your application and retrieving an application access token without pre-registration in the ING Developer portal using eIDAS/OBIE certificates supporting PSD2. This flow will automatically subscribe your application to the allowed ING APIs based on the PSD2 roles in the certificate. The scopes in the application access token are based on the PSD2 roles.
Required request parameters:
 - grant_type=client_credentials
- TPP-Signature-Certificate: PSD2 compliant Qualified Electronic Seal Certificate (QSealC)

 ## Client Credentials (PSD2 usage using eIDAS/OBIE certificates / unsigned (mtls only) access token)
  For authenticating your application and retrieving an application access token after onboarding  using eIDAS/OBIE certificates supporting PSD2. The scopes in the application access token are   based on the PSD2 roles received at onboarding.
 This is used for GET and PUT /oauth2/applications/* endpoints (DCR - Dynamic client registration).
 Required request parameters:
 - grant_type=client_credentials
 - client_id=the client_id received in ING API responses once onboarded
 ## Authorization Code
 For exchanging the authorization code for a customer   access token. 
Required request parameters:
 - grant_type=authorization_code
- code (required)
- redirect_uri (optional if exactly one redirect_uri stored in the system; mandatory when multiple or none)

 ## Refresh Token
For exchanging a refresh token for a new customer access token.
Required request parameters:
- grant_type=refresh_token
 - refresh_token (required)

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description:
For the 'client_credentials' grant type we require the Authorization header with the signature authentication scheme as defined in https://tools.ietf.org/html/draft-cavage-http-signatures-10. ING requires the headers '(request-target) date digest', the client ID is used as keyID, and the algorithm is 'rsa-sha256' or 'ecdsa-sha256', 'ecdsa-sha384', 'ecdsa-sha512'
For the 'authorization_code' and 'refresh_token' grant type the bearer authentication scheme with the application access token is required.

parameters.name: Signature
parameters.description: Signature header as defined in https://tools.ietf.org/html/draft-cavage-http-signatures-10. ING requires at least the headers '(request-target) date digest' Required when the Authorization header is used with the bearer auth-scheme and the application access token.

parameters.name: Date
parameters.description: The current date in the HTTP standard Date header format (see RFC7231 https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7231#section-7.1.1.2)

parameters.name: Digest
parameters.description: The SHA-256 hash value of the requests body encoded in Base64. If the body is empty, it should be the SHA-256 value of the empty string. This header is used in the Authorization Signature header.

parameters.name: TPP-Signature-Certificate
parameters.description: If your application is not registered in the ING Developer portal, you can add the PSD2 compliant Qualified Electronic Seal Certificate (QSealC) which you used for the signature in the client credentials grant type. The certificate (PEM format) needs to be the Base64 encoded

parameters.name: grant_type
parameters.description: OAuth 2.0 grant type

parameters.name: scope
parameters.description: Requested scopes in the 'client_credentials' grant type. Optional field, if not provided the registered scopes will be used. Scopes are delimited by a space and the complete field should be application/x-www-form-urlencoded

parameters.name: code
parameters.description: Required in the 'authorization_code' grant type, value is the recieved authorization code from the authorization request

parameters.name: redirect_uri
parameters.description: Required in the 'authorization_code' grant type, the 'redirect_uri' parameter as included in the authorization request.

parameters.name: refresh_token
parameters.description: Required in the 'refresh_token' grant type, the refresh token issued.

parameters.name: client_id
parameters.description: Application identifier - client_id received during onboarding.

200.description: OK Returns an access token, and optionally a refresh token and JSON Web Key set.

400.description: Bad Request - The request was invalid

500.description: Internal Server Error - The server encountered an unexpected internal error.

get.summary: Retrieve the ING Authorization server URL with a specific request identifier
get.description: Read more here https://developer.ing.com/openbanking/inspiration/news/breaking-change-for-psd2-users This endpoint stores the received data and returns a object/body with a location property containing the authorize URI with a specific reference ID for request identification.  In case of error the API returns the error description.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Application access token (bearer) received in the Client Credentials grant flow

parameters.name: Signature
parameters.description: Signature header as defined in https://tools.ietf.org/html/draft-cavage-http-signatures-10. ING requires the headers '(request-target) date digest', and the algorithm is 'rsa-sha256' or 'ecdsa-sha256', 'ecdsa-sha384', 'ecdsa-sha512'.

parameters.name: Date
parameters.description: The current date in the HTTPs standard Date header format (see RFC7231 https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7231#section-7.1.1.2)

parameters.name: Digest
parameters.description: The SHA-256 hash value of the requests body encoded in Base64. If the body is empty, it should be the SHA-256 value of the empty string.

parameters.name: redirect_uri
parameters.description: URI where user is redirected to after authorization. Only required when your application is not registered in the ING Developer portal, and your are using PSD2 compliant eIDAS/OBIE certificates

parameters.name: scope
parameters.description: List of scopes for which an authorization request is asked, separated by space. Must not be empty and it is validated based on the subscriptions of your API.

parameters.name: country_code
parameters.description: Country Code 2 letter value(ISO 3166-1). The country code is optional, and allows you to redirect you user to a specific ING country login page.

200.description: OK Response body containing the authorisation url where you can redirect your user to, to obtain the authorization for the requested scopes.

500.description: Internal Server Error - The server encountered an unexpected internal error.
